alert.note: Alert for Rabun (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 11:46AM EST until February 07 at 1:56AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff continues. * WHERE...Portions of Habersham and Rabun Counties. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST. * IMPACTS...River or streamflows remain elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1144 AM EST, Lingering flooding of low-lying areas will become increasingly limited to the larger drainages such as the Chattooga, Tallulah and Soque Rivers this afternoon. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Clayton, Clarkesville, Cornelia, Baldwin, Demorest, Mount Airy, Alto, Mountain City, Tiger, Tallulah Falls, Lake Rabun, Lakemont, Lake Burton, Tallulah Gorge State Park, Black Rock Mountain State Park, Raoul, Seed Lake, Turnerville, Hollywood and Batesville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
